SENT.plain: We report two pediatric patients with unclassified myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) by the French-American-British (FAB) group
Both cases had clinical and hematological peculiarities, which had not been described yet
The cytogenetic alterations were 4q deletion and the Philadelphia (Ph) chromosome which appeared at different moments of the disease
One patient showed the Ph chromosome at disease transformation and the other at diagnosis
The different breakpoints at 4q and the presence of Ph could be a marker of this form of MDS
The association of clinical and hematological findings suggests the possibility of a new group of pediatric MDS
